validmind.vm_models

Models entrypoint

@dataclass()
class Dataset:

Model class wrapper

Dataset( raw_dataset: object, fields: list, sample: list, shape: dict, correlation_matrix: object = None, correlations: dict = None, type: str = None, options: dict = None, statistics: dict = None, targets: dict = None, target_column: str = '', class_labels: dict = None, _feature_lookup: dict = None, _transformed_df: object = None)
df

Returns the raw Pandas DataFrame

x

Returns the dataset's features

y

Returns the dataset's target column

index

Returns the dataset's index.

isnull

Returns True if there are any null values in the dataset or the index, False otherwise.

copy

Returns a copy of the raw_dataset.

def drop_columns(self, columns_to_drop):

Drop specified columns of the raw_dataset.

def get_feature_by_id(self, feature_id):

Returns the feature with the given id. We also build a lazy lookup cache in case the same feature is requested multiple times.

Arguments:
  • feature_id (str): The id of the feature to return
Raises:
  • ValueError: If the feature with the given id does not exist
Returns:

dict: The feature with the given id

def get_feature_type(self, feature_id):

Returns the type of the feature with the given id

Arguments:
  • feature_id (str): The id of the feature to return
Returns:

str: The type of the feature with the given id

def get_features_columns(self):

Returns list of features columns

Returns:

list: The list of features columns

def get_numeric_features_columns(self):

Returns list of numeric features columns

Returns:

list: The list of numberic features columns

def get_categorical_features_columns(self):

Returns list of categorical features columns

Returns:

list: The list of categorical features columns

def serialize(self):

Serializes the model to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

def describe(self):

Extracts descriptive statistics for each field in the dataset

def get_correlations(self):

Extracts correlations for each field in the dataset

def get_correlation_plots(self, n_top=15):

Extracts correlation plots for the n_top correlations in the dataset

Arguments:
  • n_top (int, optional): The number of top correlations to extract. Defaults to 15.
Returns:

list: A list of correlation plots

transformed_dataset

Returns a transformed dataset that uses the features from vm_dataset. Some of the features in vm_dataset are of type Dummy so we need to reverse the one hot encoding and drop the individual dummy columns

Arguments:
  • force_refresh (bool, optional): Whether to force a refresh of the transformed dataset. Defaults to False.
Returns:

pd.DataFrame: The transformed dataset

@classmethod
def create_from_dict(cls, dict_):

Creates a Dataset object from a dictionary

Arguments:
  • dict_ (dict): The dictionary to create the Dataset object from
Returns:

Dataset: The Dataset object

@classmethod
def init_from_pd_dataset( cls, df, options=None, targets=None, target_column=None, class_labels=None):

Initializes a Dataset object from a pandas DataFrame

Arguments:
  • df (pd.DataFrame): The pandas DataFrame to initialize the Dataset object from
  • options (dict, optional): The options to use when initializing the Dataset object. Defaults to None.
  • targets (list, optional): The targets to use when initializing the Dataset object. Defaults to None.
  • target_column (str, optional): The target column to use when initializing the Dataset object. Defaults to None.
  • class_labels (list, optional): The class labels to use when initializing the Dataset object. Defaults to None.
Returns:

Dataset: The Dataset object

@dataclass()
class DatasetTargets:

Dataset targets definition

DatasetTargets( target_column: str, description: str = None, class_labels: dict = None)
@dataclass
class Figure:

Figure objects track the schema supported by the ValidMind API

Figure( key: str, figure: object, metadata: Optional[dict] = None, for_object: Optional[object] = None, extras: Optional[dict] = None)
def is_matplotlib_figure(self) -> bool:

Returns True if the figure is a matplotlib figure

def is_plotly_figure(self) -> bool:

Returns True if the figure is a plotly figure

def serialize(self):

Serializes the Figure to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

@dataclass
class Metric(validmind.vm_models.TestContextUtils):

Metric objects track the schema supported by the ValidMind API

TODO: Metric should validate required context too

Metric( test_context: validmind.vm_models.TestContext, params: dict = None, result: validmind.vm_models.TestPlanMetricResult = None)
key

Keep the key for compatibility reasons

def description(self):

Return the metric description. Should be overridden by subclasses. Defaults to returning the class' docstring

def summary( self, metric_value: Union[dict, list, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, NoneType] = None):

Return the metric summary. Should be overridden by subclasses. Defaults to None. The metric summary allows renderers (e.g. Word and ValidMind UI) to display a short summary of the metric results.

We return None here because the metric summary is optional.

def run(self, *args, **kwargs):

Run the metric calculation and cache its results

def cache_results( self, metric_value: Union[dict, list, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, NoneType] = None, figures: Optional[List[validmind.vm_models.Figure]] = None):

Cache the results of the metric calculation and do any post-processing if needed

Arguments:
  • metric_value (Union[dict, list, pd.DataFrame]): The value of the metric
  • figures (Optional[object]): Any figures to attach to the test plan result
Returns:

TestPlanResult: The test plan result object

Inherited Members
TestContextUtils
df
validate_context
@dataclass
class MetricResult:

MetricResult class definition. A MetricResult is returned by any internal method that extracts metrics from a dataset or model, and returns 1) Metric and Figure objects that can be sent to the API and 2) and plots and metadata for display purposes

MetricResult( type: str, scope: str, key: dict, value: Union[dict, list, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame], summary: Optional[validmind.vm_models.ResultSummary] = None, value_formatter: Optional[str] = None)
def serialize(self):

Serializes the Metric to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

@dataclass
class Model:

A class that wraps a trained model instance and its associated data.

Attributes:
  • attributes (ModelAttributes, optional): The attributes of the model. Defaults to None.
  • task (str, optional): The task that the model is intended to solve. Defaults to None.
  • subtask (str, optional): The subtask that the model is intended to solve. Defaults to None.
  • params (dict, optional): The parameters of the model. Defaults to None.
  • model_id (str): The identifier of the model. Defaults to "main".
  • model (object, optional): The trained model instance. Defaults to None.
  • train_ds (Dataset, optional): The training dataset. Defaults to None.
  • test_ds (Dataset, optional): The test dataset. Defaults to None.
  • validation_ds (Dataset, optional): The validation dataset. Defaults to None.
  • y_train_predict (object, optional): The predicted outputs for the training dataset. Defaults to None.
  • y_test_predict (object, optional): The predicted outputs for the test dataset. Defaults to None.
  • y_validation_predict (object, optional): The predicted outputs for the validation dataset. Defaults to None.
Model( attributes: validmind.vm_models.ModelAttributes = None, task: str = None, subtask: str = None, params: dict = None, model_id: str = 'main', model: object = None, train_ds: validmind.vm_models.Dataset = None, test_ds: validmind.vm_models.Dataset = None, validation_ds: validmind.vm_models.Dataset = None, y_train_predict: object = None, y_test_predict: object = None, y_validation_predict: object = None)
def serialize(self):

Serializes the model to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

def class_predictions(self, y_predict):

Converts a set of probability predictions to class predictions

Arguments:
  • y_predict (np.array, pd.DataFrame): Predictions to convert
Returns:

(np.array, pd.DataFrame): Class predictions

def predict(self, *args, **kwargs):

Predict method for the model. This is a wrapper around the model's predict_proba (for classification) or predict (for regression) method

NOTE: This only works for sklearn or xgboost models at the moment

@staticmethod
def model_library(model):

Returns the model library name

@staticmethod
def model_class(model):

Returns the model class name

@staticmethod
def is_supported_model(model):

Checks if the model is supported by the API

Arguments:
  • model (object): The trained model instance to check
Returns:

bool: True if the model is supported, False otherwise

@classmethod
def init_vm_model(cls, model, train_ds, test_ds, validation_ds, attributes):

Initializes a model instance from the provided data.

@classmethod
def create_from_dict(cls, dict_):

Creates a Model instance from a dictionary

Arguments:
  • dict_ (dict): The dictionary to create the Model instance from
Returns:

Model: The Model instance created from the dictionary

@dataclass()
class ModelAttributes:

Model attributes definition

ModelAttributes( architecture: str = None, framework: str = None, framework_version: str = None)
R_MODEL_TYPES = ['LogisticRegression', 'LinearRegression', 'XGBClassifier', 'XGBRegressor']
@dataclass()
class ResultSummary:

A dataclass that holds the summary of a metric or threshold test results

ResultSummary(results: List[validmind.vm_models.ResultTable])
def add_result(self, result: validmind.vm_models.ResultTable):

Adds a result to the list of results

def serialize(self):

Serializes the ResultSummary to a list of results

@dataclass
class ResultTable:

A dataclass that holds the table summary of result

ResultTable( data: Union[List[Any], pandas.core.frame.DataFrame], type: str = 'table', metadata: validmind.vm_models.ResultTableMetadata = None)
def serialize(self):

Serializes the Figure to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

@dataclass
class ResultTableMetadata:

A dataclass that holds the metadata of a table summary

ResultTableMetadata(title: str)
@dataclass
class TestContext:

Holds context that can be used by tests to run. Allows us to store data that needs to be reused across different tests/metrics such as shared dataset metrics, etc.

TestContext( dataset: validmind.vm_models.Dataset = None, model: validmind.vm_models.Model = None, models: List[validmind.vm_models.Model] = None, context_data: dict = None)
def set_context_data(self, key, value):
def get_context_data(self, key):
class TestContextUtils:

Utility methods for classes that receive a TestContext

TODO: more validation

df

Returns a Pandas DataFrame for the dataset, first checking if we passed in a Dataset or a DataFrame

def validate_context(self):

Validates that the context elements are present in the instance so that the test plan can be run

@dataclass
class TestPlan:

Base class for test plans. Test plans are used to define any arbitrary grouping of tests that will be run on a dataset or model.

TestPlan( config: {} = None, _global_config: {} = None, _test_configs: {} = None, test_context: validmind.vm_models.TestContext = None, _test_plan_instances: List[object] = None, dataset: validmind.vm_models.Dataset = None, model: validmind.vm_models.Model = None, models: List[validmind.vm_models.Model] = None, pbar: ipywidgets.widgets.widget_int.IntProgress = None, pbar_description: ipywidgets.widgets.widget_string.Label = None, pbar_box: ipywidgets.widgets.widget_box.HBox = None, summary: str = None)
def title(self):

Returns the title of the test plan. Defaults to the title version of the test plan name

def description(self):

Returns the description of the test plan. Defaults to the docstring of the test plan

def validate_context(self):

Validates that the context elements are present in the instance so that the test plan can be run

def get_config_params_for_test(self, test_name):

Returns the config for a given test, if it exists. The config attribute is a dictionary where the keys are the test names and the values are dictionaries of config values for that test.

The key in the config must match the name of the test, i.e. for a test called "time_series_univariate_inspection_raw" we could pass a config like this:

{ "time_series_univariate_inspection_raw": { "columns": ["col1", "col2"] } }

def run(self, render_summary: bool = True, send: bool = True):

Runs the test plan

Arguments:
  • render_summary: Defaults to True. Whether to render the summary of the test plan. When it's False, this allows test suites to collect the results of sub test plans and render them all at once with widgets
  • send: Whether to send the results to the backend
Returns:

None

async def log_results(self):

Logs the results of the test plan to ValidMind

This method will be called after the test plan has been run and all results have been collected. This method will log the results to ValidMind.

def summarize(self, render_summary: bool = True):

Summarizes the results of the test plan

This method will be called after the test plan has been run and all results have been logged to ValidMind. It will summarize the results of the test plan by creating an html table with the results of each test. This html table will be displayed in an VS Code, Jupyter or other notebook environment.

def get_results( self, result_id: str = None) -> List[validmind.vm_models.test_plan_result.TestPlanResult]:

Returns one or more results of the test plan. Includes results from sub test plans.

@dataclass
class TestPlanMetricResult(validmind.vm_models.test_plan_result.TestPlanResult):

Result wrapper for metrics that run as part of a test plan

TestPlanMetricResult( name: str = 'Metric', result_id: str = None, result_metadata: List[dict] = None, figures: Optional[List[validmind.vm_models.Figure]] = None, metric: Optional[validmind.vm_models.MetricResult] = None)
async def log(self):

Log the result... Must be overridden by subclasses

@dataclass
class TestPlanTestResult(validmind.vm_models.test_plan_result.TestPlanResult):

async def log(self):

Log the result... Must be overridden by subclasses

@dataclass
class TestResult:

TestResult model

def serialize(self):

Serializes the TestResult to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

@dataclass
class TestResults:

TestResults model

TestResults( category: str, test_name: str, params: dict, passed: bool, results: List[validmind.vm_models.TestResult], summary: Optional[validmind.vm_models.ResultSummary])
def serialize(self):

Serializes the TestResults to a dictionary so it can be sent to the API

@dataclass
class TestSuite(validmind.vm_models.TestPlan):

Base class for test suites. Test suites are used to define any arbitrary grouping of test plans that will be run on a dataset and/or model.

TestSuite( config: {} = None, _global_config: {} = None, _test_configs: {} = None, test_context: validmind.vm_models.TestContext = None, _test_plan_instances: List[object] = None, dataset: validmind.vm_models.Dataset = None, model: validmind.vm_models.Model = None, models: List[validmind.vm_models.Model] = None, pbar: ipywidgets.widgets.widget_int.IntProgress = None, pbar_description: ipywidgets.widgets.widget_string.Label = None, pbar_box: ipywidgets.widgets.widget_box.HBox = None, summary: str = None)
def get_total_tests(self):

Goes through every test plans and sums the number of tests for each one.

def run(self, send=True):

Runs the test suite.

def summarize(self):

Summarizes the results of the test suite.

results

Returns the results of the test suite.

@dataclass
class ThresholdTest(validmind.vm_models.TestContextUtils):

A threshold test is a combination of a metric/plot we track and a corresponding set of parameters and thresholds values that allow us to determine whether the metric/plot passes or fails.

TODO: ThresholdTest should validate required context too

ThresholdTest( test_context: validmind.vm_models.TestContext, params: dict = None, result: validmind.vm_models.TestResults = None)
def description(self):

Return the test description. Should be overridden by subclasses. Defaults to returning the class' docstring

def summary( self, results: Optional[List[validmind.vm_models.TestResult]], all_passed: bool):

Return the threshold test summary. Should be overridden by subclasses. Defaults to showing a table with test_name(optional), column and passed.

The test summary allows renderers (e.g. Word and ValidMind UI) to display a short summary of the test results.

def run(self, *args, **kwargs):

Run the test and cache its results

def cache_results( self, test_results_list: List[validmind.vm_models.TestResult], passed: bool, figures: Optional[List[validmind.vm_models.Figure]] = None):

Cache the individual results of the threshold test as a list of TestResult objects

Arguments:
  • result (List[TestResult]): The results of the threshold test
  • passed (bool): Whether the threshold test passed or failed
Returns:

TestPlanResult: The test plan result object

Inherited Members
TestContextUtils
df
